Content-type: text/plain;
	charset="US-ASCII"
Content-transfer-encoding: 7bit

Hello all-

You might be interested to know that CPPNs are again getting international
attention, this time incarnated as a way to evolve 3D objects on
EndlessForms.com. It's another great demonstration of the power of Ken's
brilliant idea, as well as validation of the ideas of the Picbreeder team in
terms of how best to explore the space of CPPN designs with interactive
evolution, since EndlessForms implemented as many of those great ideas as we
could: 

http://www.newscientist.com/blogs/onepercent/2011/08/evolve-your-own-objects
-for-3d.html 

PS. Here are a few other stories on the subject:

http://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2011/08/110818101433.htm

http://www.ecampusnews.com/top-news/academics-look-to-evolve-3d-printing/

Best regards,
Jeff Clune

Postdoctoral Fellow
Hod Lipson's Creative Machines Lab
Cornell University
jeffclune@...
jeffclune.com <http://jeffclune.com>




--B_3396950905_4596632
